â
The '''Galaxy Nexus'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the successor to the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]] and is scheduled to be released in November.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=Gizmodo report}}</ref>
+
The '''Galaxy Nexus'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the successor to the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]] and is scheduled to be released in November, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=Gizmodo report}}</ref>
